document_title: Acute prostatitis: Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Acute prostatitis often occurs suddenly and can lead to many serious complications if not treated early. However, patients can completely proactively prevent it from the beginning with some positive solutions as follows: (4)
1. Maintain hygiene
Men need to clean their genitals and surrounding areas every day to prevent the penetration and growth of harmful bacteria. This is a simple solution but brings many positive benefits, helping to minimize the common condition of prostatitis.
2. Avoid habits that harm the prostate
Cycling or sitting in one place for too long will put pressure on the prostate, over time leading to inflammation. Therefore, here are two habits that need to be changed to minimize this serious condition.
3. Exercise
The habit of exercising at least 3 times a week will help improve physical and mental health, especially reducing stress and balancing emotions. This is also a solution to maintain a healthy prostate, minimizing acute inflammation.
4. Add enough water to the body
Acute prostatitis can occur due to bacterial invasion in the urinary tract, causing infection. Therefore, adding enough water every day is really necessary to help the urine excretion process go smoothly.
5. Eat lots of green vegetables and fruits
Green vegetables and fruits are ideal nutritional supplements for the body, helping to effectively fight inflammation and infection. For men, to prevent prostatitis, the daily menu should contain the following foods:
Tomato.; Berries (strawberries, raspberries, blueberries...).; Broccoli.; Green tea.; Pomegranate Juice.; Beans (peanuts, soybeans, lentils...).; Citrus fruits.
6. Maintain a reasonable weight
Being overweight puts pressure on the body, including the prostate, and in the long run can lead to infection. Therefore, exercising and building a healthy diet to maintain a reasonable weight is really necessary.
7. Manage stress
Men who are often stressed and anxious will face a higher risk of acute prostatitis. So stress management is really important. Men should practice whole-body relaxation exercises, meditation, yoga... to balance their emotions or contact a doctor immediately if they cannot solve the problem.
8. Have safe sex
Sexually transmitted infections are also one of the causes of prostatitis. This condition often occurs when not using safe measures during sex (wearing condoms), causing bacteria to move into the urethra, causing infection.
